title: Update: baCK, version 0.02
content:
Ok, i've uploaded a new version with a Bounder inside...
There's a lot of work to do, but for the next two weeks I dont have time, so dont expect anything (however it's possible that I program anyway

Btw, does someone know, where the sound-propierties are stored in the exe? Because every sound has a priority which indicates if another osund is stopped or so (u can notice that if u die or get a life)
Thanks in advance..

[url=http://home.arcor.de/panthele/peter/back.zip]Download v0.02[/url]


MfG
OnkelPeterle

title: Re: baCK, version 0.00000000.........001 :)
content: Uhh, yeah. I had to download a whole bunch of DLLs that weren't included in the download in order to play it, and when I finally got it working, the background was misaligned with the window, so the slug, assuming he was actually there, was below the viewing area.[center]<font color="MAROON">TOUGH GUYS DON'T FOLLOW FADS</font>[/center]

title: Re: baCK, version 0.00000000.........001 :)
content:
Hm, thats strange... can u take a picture of it? And btw: what dll's do u need further?

MfG
OnkelPeterle

PS: u can scroll the screen with the keyboard and the slug should be near the end (so u have basiclly just to scroll a little bit down and maybe a little bit right)

title: Re: baCK, version 0.00000000.........001 :)
content:
[img]http://www.psychoholiday.com/uploaded/keenbackwtf.gif[/img]

I had to download MSVCIRTD.dll, MSVCRTD.dll, and MSVCP60D.dll, IIRC.[center]TOUGH GUYS DON'T FOLLOW FADS[/center]

title: Re: baCK, version 0.00000000.........001 :)
content:
Well, u should just scroll the screen down with the coursor-keys [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] (near the exit there is a little slug which should walk there - u can controll it by pressing ctrl + coursor-keys)
And the background is no misalignement: the brown top is like it is stored in the map-file (although there is a scroll-seperator, so u should normally never see it - i've already implemented stuff like that, but without a player it's not activated). And sorry for the dll's: this is because i compiled a debug-enabled-version (and no retail-version - so u'll need the debug-dll's from the msvcrt). The next version should run without that extra dlls [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

MfG

PS: I've uploaded a new exe which should use only the normal versions of the dlls (so without the ending 'D': MSVCIRT.dll, MSVCRT.dll, and MSVCP60.dll) which everyone of u should already have on his system...

title: 0.ooh!
content:
Stunning. IIRK, you're reverse engineering via a disassembler, no? Already looking impressively accurate. This could be the Keen4 remake yet... here's hoping. Can't wait to see some true Keenish movement physics. Cave assectatorem Ductoris Alacris

A concerned member of the Preservation of Endangered Spleens Society

[url=http://jimsoft.spatang.com/]JimSoft Lair[/url]

title: Re: 0.ooh!
content:
Well, yes I am [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

And the physics will be 1:1 like in the original games (however i will not allow bugs like impossible bullet or so, because it would mean some disadvantages like limited objects per level or so - well, i could programm this bug in, but that would be annoying [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

MfG

title: Re: 0.ooh!
content: [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-stunned.gif[/img] First that Vorticons clone and now this!Eat your veggies!
